body:
[![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/aarongodin/jsonschema.svg)](https://github.com/aarongodin/jsonschema/releases)
[![CI](https://github.com/aarongodin/jsonschema/actions/workflows/crystal.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/aarongodin/jsonschema/actions/workflows/crystal.yml)
![GitHub](https://img.shields.io/github/license/aarongodin/jsonschema?style=plastic)

# jsonschema

Comprehensive [JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/) validation and generator for Crystal. Read below for a high-level description of the API, or check out the [API Docs](https://aarongodin.github.io/jsonschema/) for full details.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     jsonschema:
       github: aarongodin/jsonschema
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Overview

* Read JSON files from your file system **at compile time** and generate Crystal code to convert a JSON Schema document to a `JSONSchema::Validator` object.
* Create `JSONSchema::Validator` instances during runtime by providing JSON input to `JSONSchema.from_json()`
* Build `JSONSchema::Validator` objects using a fluent API directly in your application code.

## Usage

### Generating Validators

Generate code using the provided macros which output a reference to a `JSONSchema::Validator` object. You can assign the value to a variable or use it any place an expression can be used.

```crystal
require "jsonschema"
validator = JSONSchema.create_validator "my_schema.json"
```

You can use `create_validator_method` to define a method that returns the reference to the `JSONSchema::Validator`.

```crystal
class RequestBody
  JSONSchema.create_validator_method "my_schema.json"
end
```

This is syntactically equivalent to:

```crystal
class RequestBody
  def validator : JSONSchema::Validator
    JSONSchema.create_validator "my_schema.json"
  end
end
```

The `create_validator_method` macro allows you to also customize the method name that is generated by passing a second argument:

```crystal
class ExampleRoute
  JSONSchema.create_validator_method "request_schema.json", "request_body_validator"
  JSONSchema.create_validator_method "response_schema.json", "response_body_validator"
end

r = ExampleRoute.new

r.request_body_validator # => #<JSONSchema::ObjectValidator:...
r.response_body_validator # => #<JSONSchema::ObjectValidator:...
```

> **Omitting extension**: You can omit the file extension in any of the macros, in which case a file with `.json` as the extension will be loaded.
> ex:
> ```crystal
> JSONSchema.create_validator "my_schema" # => Loads "my_schema.json"
> ```

### Validating JSON

Use the `#validate` method on any generated validator to receive a `JSONSchema::ValidationResult`:

```crystal
require "json"
require "jsonschema"

class RequestBody
  JSONSchema.create_validator_method "my_schema.json"
end

request_body = RequestBody.new
input_json = JSON.parse(%{{"test": "example"}})

request_body.validator.validate(input_json) # => JSONSchema::ValidationResult(@status=:success, @errors=[])
```

The `JSONSchema::ValidationResult` will contain either `:success` or `:error` as the `status`. On `:error`, you can check the `@errors` array for a list of `JSONSchema::ValidationError` and respond in your code accordingly.

### Context

When a `ValidationError` is created, it includes a `NodeContext` object which represents the location where the error occurred. You can get the value from this location by using `NodeContext#dig_into`:

```crystal
result = validator.validate(input_json)
result.errors[0].context.dig_into(input_json) # => returns JSON::Any() that wraps value at that location
```

You can get a string path with `NodeContext#to_s` similar to what `jq` ([ref](https://stedolan.github.io/jq/)) uses for pathing.

```crystal
result = validator.validate(input_json)
result.errors[0].context.to_s # => String such as ".person.name" or ".example[2].title"
```

### Create From JSON Input

Use the `.from_json` method to create `JSONSchema::Validator` objects from any parsed JSON.

```crystal
validator = JSONSchema.from_json(JSON.parse(
  <<-JSON
    {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "name": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    }
  JSON
))

validator.validate(JSON.parse("...elided")) # => JSONSchema::ValidationResult(@status=:success, @errors=[])
```

### Create From Fluent API

The fluent API is a DSL for concise syntax for generating `JSONSchema::Validator` objects. Here's an example that shows a complex schema represented using the fluent API.

```crystal
require "jsonschema"

js = JSONSchema.fluent

validator = js.object do
  prop "first_name", (js.string do
    min_length 2
    max_length 64
  end)

  prop "last_name", (js.string do
    min_length 2
    max_length 64
  end)

  prop "email", js.string { format "email" }

  prop "address", (js.object do
    prop "street", js.string
    prop "city", js.string
    prop "state", js.string
    prop "zipcode", js.string
  end)

  prop "nicknames", (js.array do
    min_items 1
    items js.string
  end)
end
```

## json-schema Features

### Core Types

All JSON Schema types _are_ supported!

* `string`
* `number` and `integer`
* `array`
* `object`
* `null`
* `boolean`

The generic keywords `const` and `enum` are also supported.

* `enum` can be provided either as a generic keyword (schema without a `type` value), or on a typed schema.
* `const` may only be provided as a generic keyword.

### Composite Schema

Composite schemas using `not`, `anyOf`, `allOf`, or `oneOf` _are_ supported! These can be used on any schema, including a generic one with no `type`.

### Conditional Schema

Using `dependentRequired`, `dependentSchemas` and `if-then-else` _are_ supported!

### String Formats

JSON Schema provides a number of format keywords that require the validation to restrict the string to values matching the format. This module pulls in [crystal-validator](https://github.com/Nicolab/crystal-validator) to perform most of the validations, and relies on regex for the rest.

### Illogical Schema

It's possible to make a JSON schema that is logically impossible. For example, you could create a composite schema that checks that a value is both a number and a string. The generator tries to prevent this from happening. Since the schema is processed through macros, it seems better to present you a compile error that the schema is illogical than to allow you to use a schema that would be additional work to support in the code, but not actually validate anything.

Calling this out here as this is different behavior than most JSON Schema tools out there. Many libraries implement the rules and rely on the user to write a logical schema.

## Unsupported

These features of JSON Schema are not yet supported, but will be supported in a future release (at least before `1.0.0`).

* [References](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/structuring.html#ref), `$id`, `$anchor`, and any other relationship-driven schema definition.
* [Media Types](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/non_json_data.html)

### Dialects

The latest revision of this shard only supports the latest revision of JSON Schema (2020-12). There is not yet support for using a different dialect.

## Roadmap

I would like to focus on these features beyond JSON schema that will make this library more useful in a variety of implementations:

1. **Message customization/i18n**: This module has a list of error messages that should be made customizable.

## Acknowledgements

The source for this shard is inspired by the `ECR` and `JSON` implementations from the std lib. Thanks to the Crystal team for creating an amazing standard library!

class_methods.name: fluent
class_methods.doc:
Accessor for the Fluent API. See the `JSONSchema::Fluent` class for details on creating validators through
methods on the Fluent API.

class_methods.name: from_json
class_methods.doc:
Generates a `Validator` object from the `JSON::Any` provided as input.
Raises if the schema is not created due to invalid schema.
To generate the schema at compile time, see the `JSONSchema#create_validator` macro.

```
schema = JSON.parse(%<{"type": "string"}>)
validator = JSONSchema::Runtime.create_validator schema
```
class_methods.summary: Generates a Validator object from the JSON::Any provided as input.

def.name: from_json
def.body:
begin
  node.as_h
rescue
  raise(InvalidSchemaJSONError.new("root node must be an object"))
end
define_schema(node)

class_methods.name: from_json?
class_methods.doc:
Generates a `Validator` object from the `JSON::Any` provided as input.
Returns `nil` if a validator cannot be created from the input JSON.

```
schema = JSON.parse(%<{"type": "string"}>)
validator = JSONSchema::Runtime.create_validator schema
```
class_methods.summary: Generates a Validator object from the JSON::Any provided as input.

macros.name: create_validator
macros.doc:
Generates code for a `Validator` object from the JSON schema in `filename`.

```
validator = JSONSchema.create_validator "my_schema.json"
```
macros.summary: Generates code for a Validator object from the JSON schema in filename.

macros.name: create_validator_method
macros.doc:
Generates code for defining a method that returns a `Validator` object from the JSON schema in `filename`.

```
class Body
  JSONSchema.create_validator_method "my_schema.json"
end

b = Body.new
b.validator # => #<JSONSchema::ObjectValidator:...
```
macros.summary: Generates code for defining a method that returns a Validator object from the JSON schema in filename.

def.name: create_validator_method

macros.name: create_validator_method
macros.doc:
Generates code for defining a method that returns a `Validator` object from the JSON schema in `filename`,
with a custom method name.

```
class Request
  JSONSchema.create_validator_method "request_schema.json", "request_body_validator"
  JSONSchema.create_validator_method "response_schema.json", "response_body_validator"
end

r = Request.new

r.request_body_validator  # => #<JSONSchema::ObjectValidator:...
r.response_body_validator # => #<JSONSchema::ObjectValidator:...
```
macros.summary: Generates code for defining a method that returns a Validator object from the JSON schema in filename, with a custom method name.

def.name: create_validator_method

types.name: ArrayValidator
types.doc:
Validates schema where the `type` is `array`.

This is a raw `Validator` class that you most likely do not need to use directly.
See the `JSONSchema#create_validator` macro, `JSONSchema#from_json`, or `JSONSchema.fluent` for common usage of this shard.
types.summary: Validates schema where the type is array.

def.name: to_cr
def.body:
options = {} of String => String
if @items.nil?
else
  options["items"] = (@items.as(Validator)).to_cr
end
if @prefix_items.size == 0
else
  options["prefix_items"] = "[#{@prefix_items.join(", ", &.to_cr)}] of JSONSchema::Validator"
end
if @has_disabled_additional_items
  options["has_disabled_additional_items"] = "true"
end
if @contains.nil?
else
  options["contains"] = (@contains.as(Validator)).to_cr
end
if @min_contains.nil?
else
  options["min_contains"] = @min_contains.to_s
end
if @max_contains.nil?
else
  options["max_contains"] = @max_contains.to_s
end
if @min_items.nil?
else
  options["min_items"] = @min_items.to_s
end
if @max_items.nil?
else
  options["max_items"] = @max_items.to_s
end
if @unique_items
  options["unique_items"] = "true"
end
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  options["enum_list"] = stringify_enum_list(@enum_list)
end
if @composites.size == 0
else
  options["composites"] = "[#{@composites.join(", ", &.to_cr)}]"
end
create_instance(options)

def.name: validate
def.body:
value = begin
  node.as_a
rescue
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value to be an array", context)])
end
errors = [] of ValidationError
if @items.nil?
else
  value.each_with_index do |item, i|
    result = (@items.as(Validator)).validate(item)
    if (    result.status == (:error))
      errors.concat(result.errors)
    end
  end
end
if @prefix_items.size == 0
else
  (@prefix_items.as(Array)).each_with_index do |prefix_item, i|
    result = prefix_item.validate(value[i])
    if (    result.status == (:error))
      errors.concat(result.errors)
    end
  end
  if @has_disabled_additional_items && value.size > @prefix_items.size
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected array to be tuple of length #{@prefix_items.size}", context))
  end
end
if @contains.nil?
else
  if (!@max_contains.nil?) || (!@min_contains.nil?)
    value_contains_results = value.select do |item|
      ((@contains.as(Validator)).validate(item)).status == (:success)
    end
    if @min_contains.nil?
    else
      if value_contains_results.size < (@min_contains.as(Int32))
        errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected array to contain at least #{@min_contains} matched items", context))
      end
    end
    if @max_contains.nil?
    else
      if value_contains_results.size > (@max_contains.as(Int32))
        errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected array to contain at most #{@max_contains} matched items", context))
      end
    end
  else
    found_contains = false
    item_iterator = value.each.take_while do |item|
      !found_contains
    end
    current_item = item_iterator.next
    while current_item.is_a?(JSON::Any)
      result = (@contains.as(Validator)).validate(current_item)
      if (      result.status == (:success))
        found_contains = true
      end
      current_item = item_iterator.next
    end
    if !found_contains
      errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected array to contain at least 1 matched item", context))
    end
  end
end
if @min_items.nil?
else
  if value.size < (@min_items.as(Int32))
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected array length to be at least #{@min_items}", context))
  end
end
if @min_items.nil?
else
  if value.size > (@max_items.as(Int32))
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected array length to be at most #{@max_items}", context))
  end
end
if @unique_items
  if value.uniq.size != value.size
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected array items to be unique", context))
  end
end
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  enum_result = JSONSchema.validate_enum(node, @enum_list, context)
  if enum_result.nil?
  else
    errors.push(enum_result.as(ValidationError))
  end
end
validate_composites(@composites, node, errors)
if errors.size > 0
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, errors)
end
ValidationResult.new(:success)

types.name: BooleanValidator
types.doc:
Validates schema where the `type` is `boolean`.

This is a raw `Validator` class that you most likely do not need to use directly.
See the `JSONSchema#create_validator` macro, `JSONSchema#from_json`, or `JSONSchema.fluent` for common usage of this shard.
types.summary: Validates schema where the type is boolean.

def.name: validate
def.body:
begin
  node.as_bool
rescue
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value to be a boolean", context)])
end
ValidationResult.new(:success)

types.name: CompositeValidator
types.doc:
Validates schema that has any of the keywords for [composite/compound schema](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/combining.html)
set as a property. The possible keywords are `allOf`, `anyOf`, `oneOf`, and `not`.

This is a raw `Validator` class that you most likely do not need to use directly.
See the `JSONSchema#create_validator` macro, `JSONSchema#from_json`, or `JSONSchema.fluent` for common usage of this shard.
types.summary: Validates schema that has any of the keywords for composite/compound schema set as a property.

def.name: validate
def.body:
results = @children.map do |child|
  child.validate(node)
end
results_with_errors = results.select do |result|
  result.status == (:error)
end
case @keyword
when "allOf"
  if results_with_errors.size > 0
    return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value to match all schemas", context)])
  end
when "anyOf"
  if (results.size - results_with_errors.size) > 0
  else
    return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value to match any of the schemas", context)])
  end
when "oneOf"
  if (results.size - results_with_errors.size) == 1
  else
    return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value to match only one of the schemas", context)])
  end
when "not"
  if results.size == results_with_errors.size
  else
    return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value not to match any of the schemas", context)])
  end
end
ValidationResult.new(:success)

types.name: Fluent
types.doc:
Contains methods for creating `JSONSchema::Validator` instances without interacting with the low-level domain objects. This class implements a
DSL through block receivers rather than the standard method-chaining fluent API seen in json-schema libraries in other languages.

An instance of this class is available through `JSONSchema.fluent`.
types.summary: Contains methods for creating JSONSchema::Validator instances without interacting with the low-level domain objects.

instance_methods.name: array
instance_methods.doc:
Create a `JSONSchema::ArrayValidator` using the fluent API. See `JSONSchema::FluentArrayValidator` for receiver methods.

```
js = JSONSchema.fluent

validator = js.array do
  unique_items
  validator js.string
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Create a JSONSchema::ArrayValidator using the fluent API.

def.name: array
def.body:
fluent = FluentArrayValidator.new
with fluent yield
fluent.validator

instance_methods.name: array
instance_methods.doc: Convenience method for creating a new `JSONSchema::ArrayValidator` without options.
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method for creating a new JSONSchema::ArrayValidator without options.

instance_methods.name: boolean
instance_methods.doc: Convenience method for creating a new `JSONSchema::BooleanValidator`.
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method for creating a new JSONSchema::BooleanValidator.

instance_methods.name: generic
instance_methods.doc:
Create a `JSONSchema::GenericValidator` using the fluent API. See `JSONSchema::FluentGenericValidator` for receiver methods.
Accepts a block to receive options for the validator.

This method does not have a corresponding non-block-accepting method because a generic validator must
have options to be a valid schema.

```
js = JSONSchema.fluent

validator = js.generic do
  enum_list "one", "two", "three"
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Create a JSONSchema::GenericValidator using the fluent API.

def.name: generic
def.body:
fluent = FluentGenericValidator.new
with fluent yield
fluent.validator

instance_methods.name: integer
instance_methods.doc:
Create a `JSONSchema::NumberValidator` with the integer constraint set using the fluent API. See `JSONSchema::FluentNumberValidator` for receiver methods.

```
js = JSONSchema.fluent

validator = js.integer do
  minimum 0
  multiple_of 5
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Create a JSONSchema::NumberValidator with the integer constraint set using the fluent API.

def.name: integer
def.body:
fluent = FluentNumberValidator.new
fluent.has_integer_constraint
with fluent yield
fluent.validator

instance_methods.name: integer
instance_methods.doc: Convenience method for creating a new `JSONSchema::NumberValidator` with the integer constraint set (and not other options).
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method for creating a new JSONSchema::NumberValidator with the integer constraint set (and not other options).

instance_methods.name: null
instance_methods.doc: Convenience method for creating a new `JSONSchema::NullValidator`.
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method for creating a new JSONSchema::NullValidator.

instance_methods.name: number
instance_methods.doc:
Create a `JSONSchema::NumberValidator` using the fluent API. See `JSONSchema::FluentNumberValidator` for receiver methods.

```
js = JSONSchema.fluent

validator = js.number do
  minimum 0
  maximum 100
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Create a JSONSchema::NumberValidator using the fluent API.

def.name: number
def.body:
fluent = FluentNumberValidator.new
with fluent yield
fluent.validator

instance_methods.name: number
instance_methods.doc: Convenience method for creating a new `JSONScheam::NumberValidator` without options.
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method for creating a new JSONScheam::NumberValidator without options.

instance_methods.name: object
instance_methods.doc:
Create a `JSONSchema::ObjectValidator` using the fluent API. See `JSONSchema::FluentObjectValidator` for receiver methods.

```
js = JSONSchema.fluent

validator = js.object do
  prop "name", js.string
  prop "age", (js.integer do
    minimum 0
  end)
  required "name", "age"
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Create a JSONSchema::ObjectValidator using the fluent API.

def.name: object
def.body:
fluent = FluentObjectValidator.new
with fluent yield
fluent.validator

instance_methods.name: object
instance_methods.doc: Convenience method for creating a new `JSONSchema::ObjectValidator` without options.
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method for creating a new JSONSchema::ObjectValidator without options.

instance_methods.name: string
instance_methods.doc:
Create a `JSONSchema::StringValidator` using the fluent API. See `JSONSchema::FluentStringValidator` for receiver methods.

```
js = JSONSchema.fluent

validator = js.string do
  min_length 10
  pattern /^[a-z0-9-_]$/
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Create a JSONSchema::StringValidator using the fluent API.

def.name: string
def.body:
fluent = FluentStringValidator.new
with fluent yield
fluent.validator

instance_methods.name: string
instance_methods.doc: Convenience method for creating a new `JSONSchema::StringValidator` without options.
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method for creating a new JSONSchema::StringValidator without options.

types.name: FluentArrayValidator
types.doc: A fluent API for creating instances of `JSONSchema::ArrayValidator`.
types.summary: A fluent API for creating instances of JSONSchema::ArrayValidator.

instance_methods.name: contains
instance_methods.doc: Set the validator to check that at least one item matches the schema. See [Contains](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html#contains).
instance_methods.summary: Set the validator to check that at least one item matches the schema.

instance_methods.name: has_disabled_additional_items
instance_methods.doc: Set the constraint that the array does not allow additional items beyond those specified in `prefix_items`. See [Additional Items](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html#additional-items).
instance_methods.summary: Set the constraint that the array does not allow additional items beyond those specified in #prefix_items.

instance_methods.name: items
instance_methods.doc:
Set a validator for items in the array. See [Items](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html#items).

```
js = JSONSchema.fluent

validator = js.array do
  items js.string { min_length 10 }
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Set a validator for items in the array.

instance_methods.name: max_contains
instance_methods.doc: Set the `max_contains`. See [Contains](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html#contains).
instance_methods.summary: Set the #max_contains.

instance_methods.name: max_items
instance_methods.doc: Set the `max_items`. See [Length](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html#length)
instance_methods.summary: Set the #max_items.

instance_methods.name: min_contains
instance_methods.doc: Set the `min_contains`. See [Contains](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html#contains).
instance_methods.summary: Set the #min_contains.

instance_methods.name: min_items
instance_methods.doc: Set the `min_items`. See [Length](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html#length)
instance_methods.summary: Set the #min_items.

instance_methods.name: prefix_items
instance_methods.doc:
Set validators for Tuple validation of the array. See [Tuple validation](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html#tuple-validation).

```
js = JSONSchema.fluent

validator = js.array do
  prefix_items(
    js.number,
    js.string,
    js.string
  )
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Set validators for Tuple validation of the array.

instance_methods.name: unique_items
instance_methods.doc: Sets the uniqueness constraint on items in the array.
instance_methods.summary: Sets the uniqueness constraint on items in the array.

types.name: FluentGenericValidator
types.doc: A fluent API for creating instances of `JSONSchema::GenericValidator`.
types.summary: A fluent API for creating instances of JSONSchema::GenericValidator.

instance_methods.name: const
instance_methods.doc:
Sets `JSONSchema::GenericValidator#const`. Learn about [const](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/generic.html#constant-values).

```
validator = JSONSchema.generic do
  const "United States"
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Sets JSONSchema::GenericValidator#const.

types.name: FluentNumberValidator
types.doc: A fluent API for creating instances of `JSONSchema::NumberValidator`.
types.summary: A fluent API for creating instances of JSONSchema::NumberValidator.

instance_methods.name: exclusive_maximum
instance_methods.doc: Sets `exclusive_maximum`. See [Range](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html#range)
instance_methods.summary: Sets #exclusive_maximum.

instance_methods.name: exclusive_minimum
instance_methods.doc: Sets `exclusive_minimum`. See [Range](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html#range)
instance_methods.summary: Sets #exclusive_minimum.

instance_methods.name: has_integer_constraint
instance_methods.doc: Sets the constraint for requiring the number to be an integer.
instance_methods.summary: Sets the constraint for requiring the number to be an integer.

instance_methods.name: maximum
instance_methods.doc: Sets `maximum`. See [Range](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html#range)
instance_methods.summary: Sets #maximum.

instance_methods.name: minimum
instance_methods.doc: Sets `minimum`. See [Range](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html#range)
instance_methods.summary: Sets #minimum.

instance_methods.name: multiple_of
instance_methods.doc: Sets `multiple_of`. See [Multiples](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html#multiples)
instance_methods.summary: Sets #multiple_of.

types.name: FluentObjectValidator
types.doc: A fluent API for creating instances of `JSONSchema::ObjectValidator`.
types.summary: A fluent API for creating instances of JSONSchema::ObjectValidator.

instance_methods.name: additional_properties
instance_methods.doc: Set the validator for any additional properties not in the properties definition. See [Additional Properties](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/object.html#additional-properties).
instance_methods.summary: Set the validator for any additional properties not in the properties definition.

instance_methods.name: dependent_required
instance_methods.doc:
Set a single dependent required property by name. See [Dependent Required](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/conditionals.html#dependentrequired).

```
validator = JSONSchema.fluent.object do
  dependent_required "creditCard", ["billingAddress"]
  dependent_required "couponCode", ["source"]
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Set a single dependent required property by name.

instance_methods.name: dependent_required
instance_methods.doc:
Set the list of dependent required properties. See [Dependent Required](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/conditionals.html#dependentrequired).

```
validator = JSONSchema.fluent.object do
  dependent_required({
    "creditCard" => ["billingAddress"],
  })
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Set the list of dependent required properties.

instance_methods.name: has_disabled_additional_properties
instance_methods.doc: Set the constraint for disabling additional properties. See [Addiitonal Properties](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/object.html#additional-properties).
instance_methods.summary: Set the constraint for disabling additional properties.

instance_methods.name: max_properties
instance_methods.doc: Set a validator for the minimum number of properties that must be on the object.
instance_methods.summary: Set a validator for the minimum number of properties that must be on the object.

instance_methods.name: min_properties
instance_methods.doc: Set a validator for the minimum number of properties that must be on the object.
instance_methods.summary: Set a validator for the minimum number of properties that must be on the object.

instance_methods.name: pattern_property
instance_methods.doc: Set the validator for a given `Regex`. See [Pattern Properties](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/object.html#pattern-properties).
instance_methods.summary: Set the validator for a given Regex.

instance_methods.name: prop
instance_methods.doc: Set the validator for a property by name. This method is named `prop` to not conflict with the global `property` macro.
instance_methods.summary: Set the validator for a property by name.

instance_methods.name: property_names
instance_methods.doc: Set a validator for all property names. See [Property names](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/object.html#property-names).
instance_methods.summary: Set a validator for all property names.

instance_methods.name: required
instance_methods.doc:
Set the list of required properties as any number of strings.

```
validator = JSONSchema.fluent.object do
  required "name", "age"
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Set the list of required properties as any number of strings.

types.name: FluentStringValidator
types.doc: A fluent API for creating instances of `JSONSchema::StringValidator`.
types.summary: A fluent API for creating instances of JSONSchema::StringValidator.

instance_methods.name: format
instance_methods.doc: Sets a format for the string. See [Format](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#format).
instance_methods.summary: Sets a format for the string.

instance_methods.name: max_length
instance_methods.doc: Sets `max_length`. See [Length](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#length)
instance_methods.summary: Sets #max_length.

instance_methods.name: min_length
instance_methods.doc: Sets `min_length`. See [Length](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#length)
instance_methods.summary: Sets #min_length.

instance_methods.name: pattern
instance_methods.doc: Sets `pattern`. See [Regular Expressions](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#regular-expressions)
instance_methods.summary: Sets #pattern.

types.name: FluentValidatorGenericProperties
types.doc:
Contains fluent methods for interfacing with generic json-schema properties such as [enum](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/generic.html#enumerated-values)
and [composite schemas](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/combining.html).
types.summary: Contains fluent methods for interfacing with generic json-schema properties such as enum and composite schemas.

instance_methods.name: all_of
instance_methods.doc: Constraint that _all_ of the passed schemas must be valid given the input JSON. Accepts any number of children as `JSONSchema::Validator` objects.
instance_methods.summary: Constraint that all of the passed schemas must be valid given the input JSON.

instance_methods.name: any_of
instance_methods.doc: Constraint that _at least one_ of the passed schemas must be valid given the input JSON. Accepts any number of children as `JSONSchema::Validator` objects.
instance_methods.summary: Constraint that at least one of the passed schemas must be valid given the input JSON.

instance_methods.name: enum_list
instance_methods.doc:
Set a list of values that are allowed for this schema. This method is not called `enum` to avoid conflicting with the `enum` keyword.

```
validator = JSONSchema.generic do
  enum_list "one", "two", "three"
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Set a list of values that are allowed for this schema.

instance_methods.name: not
instance_methods.doc: Constraint that the passed schema is not valid given the input JSON. Accepts any number of children as `JSONSchema::Validator` objects.
instance_methods.summary: Constraint that the passed schema is not valid given the input JSON.

instance_methods.name: oneOf
instance_methods.doc: Constraint that _only one_ of the passed schemas is valid given the input JSON. Accepts any number of children as `JSONSchema::Validator` objects.
instance_methods.summary: Constraint that only one of the passed schemas is valid given the input JSON.

types.name: Format
types.doc: Provides string format validations for any allowed `format` keyword.
types.summary: Provides string format validations for any allowed format keyword.

instance_methods.name: is_uri
instance_methods.doc: No URI validator at the moment; uses URL
instance_methods.summary: No URI validator at the moment; uses URL

types.name: GenericValidator
types.doc:
Validates schema that has no type. Allows for constraints such as `enum`, `const` or
composite schemas that do not require a `type` keyword (`enum` is also available on typed schemas).

This is a raw `Validator` class that you most likely do not need to use directly.
See the `JSONSchema#create_validator` macro, `JSONSchema#from_json`, or `JSONSchema.fluent` for common usage of this shard.
types.summary: Validates schema that has no type.

def.name: to_cr
def.body:
options = {} of String => String
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  options["enum_list"] = stringify_enum_list(@enum_list)
end
if @const.nil?
else
  options["const"] = stringify_json_any(@const.as(JSON::Any))
end
if @composites.size == 0
else
  options["composites"] = "[#{@composites.join(", ", &.to_cr)}]"
end
create_instance(options)

def.name: validate
def.body:
errors = [] of ValidationError
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  enum_result = JSONSchema.validate_enum(node, @enum_list, context)
  if enum_result.nil?
  else
    errors.push(enum_result.as(ValidationError))
  end
end
if @const.nil?
else
  if node == @const
  else
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected value to be #{@const}", context))
  end
end
validate_composites(@composites, node, errors)
if errors.size > 0
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, errors)
end
ValidationResult.new(:success)

types.name: InvalidSchemaError
types.doc:
Exception thrown at compile-time for any invalid schema. A schema may be invalid if the file cannot be read,
the JSON string in the file is not valid JSON (cannot be parsed), or if the resulting JSON has invalid
definitions for JSON Schema. Compile-time checks will throw this error if your schema cannot be turned into valid Crystal code,
or to protect your application from runtime errors related to a schema that would not make logical sense.
types.summary: Exception thrown at compile-time for any invalid schema.

types.name: InvalidSchemaJSONError
types.doc:
Exception thrown at runtime for any invalid schema. A runtime schema can be invalid
given the JSON does not describe a valid JSON Schema.
types.summary: Exception thrown at runtime for any invalid schema.

types.name: NodeContext
types.doc: Tracks the location of a JSON value within a JSON schema.
types.summary: Tracks the location of a JSON value within a JSON schema.

instance_methods.name: dig_into
instance_methods.doc: Calls `JSON::Any#dig` on a given input to dig to the value represented by this NodeContext.
instance_methods.summary: Calls JSON::Any#dig on a given input to dig to the value represented by this NodeContext.

def.name: dig_into
def.body:
accessors = [] of String | Int32
node = self
while !node.nil?
  if node.path == "."
    node = node.parent
    next
  end
  case node.path
  when .starts_with?('.')
    accessors.push(node.path[1..])
  when .starts_with?('[')
    accessors.push((node.path.strip("[]")).to_i)
  else
    accessors.push(node.path)
  end
  node = node.parent
end
if (accessors.size == 0)
  raise("Cannot dig on root node context")
end
accessors.reverse!
value = input.dig(accessors[0])
accessor_index = 1
while (accessor_index < accessors.size)
  value = value.dig(accessors[accessor_index])
  accessor_index = accessor_index + 1
end
value

instance_methods.name: from_property
instance_methods.doc: Create a child NodeContext based on `self`, taking into account whether `self` is the root node.
instance_methods.summary: Create a child NodeContext based on self, taking into account whether self is the root node.

def.name: from_property
def.body:
if self.path == "."
  NodeContext.new(prop, self)
else
  NodeContext.new(".#{prop}", self)
end

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Get a string representation of the node's full path. The format is dot and square bracket notation,
similar to the format expected by `jq`, a popular [JSON querying CLI](https://stedolan.github.io/jq/).

Example: `.parent.children[0].example`

The top-level `.` will always refer to the root node.
instance_methods.summary: Get a string representation of the node's full path.

def.name: to_s
def.body:
string_parts = [] of String
node = self
while !node.nil?
  string_parts.push(node.path)
  node = node.parent
end
String.build do |str|
  string_parts.reverse_each do |string_part|
    str << string_part
  end
end

types.name: NullValidator
types.doc:
Validates schema where the `type` is `null`.

This is a raw `Validator` class that you most likely do not need to use directly.
See the `JSONSchema#create_validator` macro, `JSONSchema#from_json`, or `JSONSchema.fluent` for common usage of this shard.
types.summary: Validates schema where the type is null.

def.name: validate
def.body:
begin
  node.as_nil
rescue
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value to be null", context)])
end
ValidationResult.new(:success)

types.name: NumberValidator
types.doc:
Validates schema where the `type` is `number` or `integer`.

This is a raw `Validator` class that you most likely do not need to use directly.
See the `JSONSchema#create_validator` macro, `JSONSchema#from_json`, or `JSONSchema.fluent` for common usage of this shard.
types.summary: Validates schema where the type is number or integer.

def.name: to_cr
def.body:
options = {} of String => String
if @has_integer_constraint
  options["has_integer_constraint"] = "true"
end
if @multiple_of.nil?
else
  options["multiple_of"] = @multiple_of.to_s
end
if @minimum.nil?
else
  options["minimum"] = @minimum.to_s
end
if @maximum.nil?
else
  options["maximum"] = @maximum.to_s
end
if @exclusive_minimum.nil?
else
  options["exclusive_minimum"] = @exclusive_minimum.to_s
end
if @exclusive_maximum.nil?
else
  options["exclusive_maximum"] = @exclusive_maximum.to_s
end
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  options["enum_list"] = stringify_enum_list(@enum_list)
end
if @composites.size == 0
else
  options["composites"] = "[#{@composites.join(", ", &.to_cr)}]"
end
create_instance(options)

def.name: validate
def.body:
value = begin
  begin
    node.as_f
  rescue
    node.as_i
  end
rescue
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value to be a number", context)])
end
errors = [] of ValidationError
if @has_integer_constraint && ((value % 1) != 0)
  errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected numeric value to be an integer", context))
end
if @minimum.nil?
else
  if (@minimum.as(Int32)) <= value
  else
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected numeric value be greater than or equal to #{@minimum}", context))
  end
end
if @maximum.nil?
else
  if value <= (@maximum.as(Int32))
  else
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected numeric value be less than or equal to #{@maximum}", context))
  end
end
if @exclusive_minimum.nil?
else
  if (@exclusive_minimum.as(Int32)) < value
  else
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected numeric value be greater than #{@exclusive_minimum}", context))
  end
end
if @exclusive_maximum.nil?
else
  if value < (@exclusive_maximum.as(Int32))
  else
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected numeric value be less than #{@exclusive_maximum}", context))
  end
end
if @multiple_of.nil?
else
  if (value % (multiple_of.as(Int32))) == 0
  else
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected numeric value to be multiple of #{@multiple_of}", context))
  end
end
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  enum_result = JSONSchema.validate_enum(node, @enum_list, context)
  if enum_result.nil?
  else
    errors.push(enum_result.as(ValidationError))
  end
end
validate_composites(@composites, node, errors)
if errors.size > 0
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, errors)
end
ValidationResult.new(:success)

types.name: ObjectValidator
types.doc:
Validates schema where the `type` is `object`.

This is a raw `Validator` class that you most likely do not need to use directly.
See the `JSONSchema#create_validator` macro, `JSONSchema#from_json`, or `JSONSchema.fluent` for common usage of this shard.
types.summary: Validates schema where the type is object.

def.name: to_cr
def.body:
options = {} of String => String
if @has_disabled_additional_properties
  options["has_disabled_additional_properties"] = "true"
end
if @required.nil?
else
  options["required"] = @required.to_s
end
if @property_names.nil?
else
  options["property_names"] = (@property_names.as(StringValidator)).to_cr
end
if @min_properties.nil?
else
  options["min_properties"] = @min_properties.to_s
end
if @max_properties.nil?
else
  options["max_properties"] = @max_properties.to_s
end
if @additional_properties.nil?
else
  options["additional_properties"] = (@additional_properties.as(Validator)).to_cr
end
if @dependent_required.size == 0
else
  options["dependent_required"] = @dependent_required.to_s
end
if @properties.size == 0
else
  options["properties"] = String.build do |str|
    str << "{\n"
    i = 0
    @properties.each do |prop, validator|
      str << "\"#{prop}\" => #{validator.to_cr}"
      if i >= @properties.size
      else
        str << ",\n"
      end
      i = i + 1
    end
    str << "} of String => JSONSchema::Validator"
  end
end
if @pattern_properties.size == 0
else
  options["pattern_properties"] = String.build do |str|
    str << "{\n"
    i = 0
    @pattern_properties.each do |pattern, validator|
      str << "/#{pattern.source}/ => #{validator.to_cr}"
      if i >= @pattern_properties.size
      else
        str << ",\n"
      end
      i = i + 1
    end
    str << "} of Regex => JSONSchema::Validator"
  end
end
if @composites.size == 0
else
  options["composites"] = "[#{@composites.join(", ", &.to_cr)}]"
end
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  options["enum_list"] = stringify_enum_list(@enum_list)
end
create_instance(options)

def.name: validate
def.body:
value = begin
  node.as_h
rescue
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value to be an object", context)])
end
errors = [] of ValidationError
if @required.nil?
else
  (@required.as(Array(String))).each do |required_prop|
    if value.has_key?(required_prop)
    else
      errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected required property \"#{required_prop}\" to be set", context))
    end
  end
end
if @dependent_required.size == 0
else
  @dependent_required.each do |dependent_prop, required_props|
    required_props.each do |required_prop|
      if value.has_key?(required_prop)
      else
        errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected required property \"#{required_prop}\" to be set when \"#{dependent_prop}\" is set", context))
      end
    end
  end
end
if @property_names.nil?
else
  value.keys.each do |property_name|
    result = (@property_names.as(StringValidator)).validate(JSON::Any.new(property_name), context.from_property(property_name))
    if result.status == (:error)
      errors.concat(result.errors)
    end
  end
end
if @min_properties.nil?
else
  if value.keys.size >= (@min_properties.as(Int32))
  else
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected object to have at least #{@min_properties} properties", context))
  end
end
if @max_properties.nil?
else
  if value.keys.size > (@max_properties.as(Int32))
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected object to have at most #{@max_properties} properties", context))
  end
end
@properties.each do |property_name, property_validator|
  property_value = value[property_name]?
  if property_value.nil?
  else
    result = property_validator.validate(property_value, context.from_property(property_name))
    if result.status == (:error)
      errors.concat(result.errors)
    end
  end
end
@pattern_properties.each do |pattern, pattern_validator|
  value.each do |k, v|
    if pattern =~ k
      result = pattern_validator.validate(v, context.from_property(k))
      if result.status == (:error)
        errors.concat(result.errors)
      end
    end
  end
end
additional_keys = value.keys.select do |key|
  !(@properties.has_key?(key))
end
if @has_disabled_additional_properties
  if additional_keys.size > 0
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected object not to have additional properties", context))
  end
else
  if @additional_properties.nil?
  else
    additional_keys.each do |additional_key|
      result = (@additional_properties.as(Validator)).validate(value[additional_key], context.from_property(additional_key))
      if result.status == (:error)
        errors.concat(result.errors)
      end
    end
  end
end
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  enum_result = JSONSchema.validate_enum(node, @enum_list, context)
  if enum_result.nil?
  else
    errors.push(enum_result.as(ValidationError))
  end
end
validate_composites(@composites, node, errors)
if errors.size > 0
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, errors)
end
ValidationResult.new(:success)

types.name: StringValidator
types.doc:
Validates schema where the `type` is `string`.

This is a raw `Validator` class that you most likely do not need to use directly.
See the `JSONSchema#create_validator` macro, `JSONSchema#from_json`, or `JSONSchema.fluent` for common usage of this shard.
types.summary: Validates schema where the type is string.

def.name: to_cr
def.body:
options = {} of String => String
if @min_length.nil?
else
  options["min_length"] = @min_length.to_s
end
if @max_length.nil?
else
  options["max_length"] = @max_length.to_s
end
if @pattern.nil?
else
  options["pattern"] = "/#{(@pattern.as(Regex)).source}/"
end
if @format.nil?
else
  options["format"] = @format.to_s
end
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  options["enum_list"] = stringify_enum_list(@enum_list)
end
if @composites.size == 0
else
  options["composites"] = "[#{@composites.join(", ", &.to_cr)}]"
end
create_instance(options)

def.name: validate
def.body:
value = begin
  node.as_s
rescue
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, [ValidationError.new("Expected value to be a string", context)])
end
errors = [] of ValidationError
if @min_length.nil?
else
  if (@min_length.as(Int32)) > value.size
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected string to have a minimum length of #{@min_length}", context))
  end
end
if @max_length.nil?
else
  if value.size > (@max_length.as(Int32))
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected string to have a maximum length of #{@max_length}", context))
  end
end
if @pattern.nil?
else
  if (  @pattern =~ value).nil?
    errors.push(ValidationError.new("Expected string to match pattern /#{(@pattern.as(Regex)).source}/", context))
  end
end
if @format.nil?
else
  case @format.as(String)
  when "uuid"
    self.check_format(@format.as(String), Format.is_uuid(value), errors, context)
  end
end
if @enum_list.size == 0
else
  enum_result = JSONSchema.validate_enum(node, @enum_list, context)
  if enum_result.nil?
  else
    errors.push(enum_result.as(ValidationError))
  end
end
validate_composites(@composites, node, errors)
if errors.size > 0
  return ValidationResult.new(:error, errors)
end
ValidationResult.new(:success)

types.name: ValidationError
types.doc: Captures an error message and the corresponding path to the value where the error occurred.
types.summary: Captures an error message and the corresponding path to the value where the error occurred.

instance_methods.name: context
instance_methods.doc: Provides a reference to where this error occurred in the input JSON. See `JSONSchema::NodeContext` for more information.
instance_methods.summary: Provides a reference to where this error occurred in the input JSON.

instance_methods.name: message
instance_methods.doc: Description of what error occurred.
instance_methods.summary: Description of what error occurred.

types.name: ValidationResult
types.doc: Captures result of validation, including a status and any number of corresponding errors
types.summary: Captures result of validation, including a status and any number of corresponding errors

instance_methods.name: status
instance_methods.doc: Either `:success` or `:error`
instance_methods.summary: Either :success or :error

types.name: Validator
types.aliased: (JSONSchema::ArrayValidator | JSONSchema::BooleanValidator | JSONSchema::CompositeValidator | JSONSchema::GenericValidator | JSONSchema::NullValidator | JSONSchema::NumberValidator | JSONSchema::ObjectValidator | JSONSchema::StringValidator)
types.doc:
Alias type for any type of `Validator`. The top-level `Validator` returned from the macros
can be any one of the following.
types.summary: Alias type for any type of Validator.

types.name: ValidatorRender
types.doc:
Shared module to provide render capability to Validator classes.
This module is private and intended to only be used by the macros in this library.
types.summary: Shared module to provide render capability to Validator classes.
